author: This article first appeared; Was Syndicated
title: 'I thought I'd never play tennis again': Nick Kyrgios 'puts more petrol' in the tank with Miami Open landmark win amid retirement fears
text:
Nick Kyrgios sealed his first win in two years to revive his comeback hopes as he saw off Mackenzie McDonald in three 3-6, 6-3, 6-4. But on his return to Miami, he admitted that he came close to not playing again.
Kyrgios had started a new life as a commentator and looked unlikely to make a return to tennis after wrist surgery. But it is nights like these where he was favourite against an American on home soil that he said puts petrol in the tank to keep going.
It is his first win since October 2022 and he cried on court only one week ago at Indian Wells. He also hit the headlines this week for his role in the PTPA lawsuit.
“I thought I’d never play tennis again, to be brutally honest with you. That was going that way. I’ve had conversations with my camp and my team, guys who are leaving their families to be here with me.. I was like look, I don’t know how long I can keep doing this for. This puts a bit more petrol in the tank.. but I’ve got to be realistic. I’ll see how my wrist pulls up tomorrow. It is a grind out here," said Kyrgios on court.
He also opened up on the sheer difficulty of even returning from the changing ball speed to even getting to the starting line of a match. Next up is Karen Khachanov for the popular Aussie.
“It’s tough. Honestly I saw the draw and I didn’t feel confident about facing anyone to be honest. The way my wrist has pulled up the last 6 months hasn’t been great. But I guess having one win against Mackie.. I had something to draw from experience. He’s such a good player. He’s so tricky. It definitely caught me off guard. I wasn’t used to that ball speed again. It’s been a long journey, even to just get to the start line of matches and be scared to be able to finish them.. but to come off and get a win and feel like I belong again feels pretty special.”

author: @mysuncoast
title: Priest bites woman at Mass after denying her communion, police say
text: Priest bites woman at Mass after denying her communion, police say ST. CLOUD, Fla. (WFTV) - Communion at a Florida church took an unexpected turn when police say an argument ended with a priest biting a woman attending Mass. The incident happened Sunday at St. Thomas Aquinas Catholic Church in St. Cloud. Police have recommended that the priest involved, identified on body camera video as Father Fidel, be charged with battery. The church’s [website lists](https://stacatholic.org/staff) a Fidel Rodriguez among its staff as a parochial vicar, but it is not clear if this is the same man. The unidentified woman involved in the incident told police the scuffle started when she tried to receive communion but was denied. “He wouldn’t give me the cookie. I don’t know if it was the way I was dressed or what it is that I like,” the woman can be heard saying in the bodycam video. A witness told police the woman was singled out because of her sexuality and attire. “He tried to forcefully shove it in her mouth. She backed up and said, ‘No, don’t do that.’ She tried to get it, and that’s when he went crazy,” the witness said to police. However, the priest told police a different story. He says the woman first came to the 10 o’clock Mass but didn’t seem to know the process of receiving communion, so he denied her the bread wafer. He says she came back to another service and tried again. The priest says the confrontation happened when the woman tried to grab the wafer out of his hand, telling police he was protecting the wafer because it is considered the body of Christ. He also appears to admit to biting the woman on bodycam video. “I am not judging you. I am asking you, ‘Did you confess after Mass?’ If you did not confess, I can’t give you communion. I bit her. I am not denying that. I was defending myself and the sacrament,” he said to police. The priest told officers he didn’t know the woman or what her sexual orientation is and doesn’t care about that. “I don’t judge nobody,” he said to police. The church deferred comment to the Catholic Diocese of Orlando. Reporters reached out to the diocese but have not heard back. Copyright 2024 WFTV via CNN Newsource. All rights reserved. Gray News contributed to this report.

author: Redacción Correo
title: Cynthia Martínez se quiebra al despedir a Pedro Suárez Vértiz: “Él está feliz porque nos está viendo a todos” | farandula-celebs-peru | ESPECTACULOS | CORREO
text: [Pedro Suárez Vértiz](https://diariocorreo.pe/espectaculos/william-luna-recuerda-cuando-pedro-suarez-vertiz-lo-defendia-del-bullying-en-las-redes-sociales-el-tenia-mucha-fuerza-farandula-celebs-noticia/?ref=dcr/) murió este 28 de diciembre a horas en la mañana en su domicilio en Miraflores. Cynthía Martínez, viuda del cantante, se encontraba en España cuando se confirmó la muerte del artista y retornó al país para darle el último adiós a su esposo. MIRA ESTO: [Billboard le dedica homenaje a Pedro Suárez Vértiz por su trayectoria musical] Esta tarde, Martínez se pronunció por primera vez en la misa de cuerpo presente que se llevó a cabo en la iglesia Virgen de Fátima, ubicada en el distrito de Miraflores. La madre de los hijos de Pedro Suárez Vértiz permitió ingresar al club de fans del cantautor y a la prensa para que puedan despedirse del intérprete de ‘Cuando pienses en volver’. El sacerdote la invitó a dar unas palabras frente al cuerpo de su esposo y se quebró al dar una breves palabras ante los presentes. “Acá todos lo vamos a extrañar pero adorar como siempre lo hemos hecho. Y él está feliz porque nos está viendo a todos, todos que lo amamos, gracias por venir”, se escucha decir entre lágrimas. Cinthya Martínez, esposa de Pedro Suárez Vértiz, abre las puertas del velatorio para los fans y agradece las condolencias Este viernes 29 de diciembre, la iglesia Virgen de Fátima en Miraflores se convierte en el escenario del sentido velorio de Pedro Suárez Vértiz, quien partió de este mundo hace apenas un día en su residencia del mismo distrito. Amigos, familiares y admiradores se reúnen para despedir al talentoso artista y rendir homenaje a su legado. Antes del mediodía, Cinthya Martínez, esposa de Pedro, salió hasta la puerta del velatorio, para permitir el ingreso de los fans, que aguardaban en los exteriores desde muy temprano. Junto a ella estaba su hijo Mateo. La esposa del cantante recibió uno a uno a los seguidores y recibió sus condolencias, en un noble gesto de agradecimiento por el apoyo que le brindaron durante toda su carrera. author: @TUDNUSA
title: Estrella rompe con las ilusiones de Sergio | Novelas A Mar | Las Estrellas
text:
PUBLICIDAD
A Mar
Estrella rompe con las ilusiones de Sergio
Sergio le reitera a Estrella que su gran sueño es estar juntos y formar una familia, pero ella le deja en claro que no piensa darle otra oportunidad. A·Mar de lunes a viernes 8:30 p. m. MEX, con Las Estrellas.
